start.md.name: start
start.md.description: Main entry point - automatically routes user requests to specialized prompts (analysis, discovery, query-building). Use this when you're unsure which prompt to invoke, or want automatic task classification.

arguments.name: task
arguments.description: User's request in natural language (e.g., 'show me top products', 'what tables are available', 'build a query for customers'). Router will classify and route to appropriate prompt.

discovery.md.name: discovery
discovery.md.description: Schema discovery and introspection workflow. Find modules, data objects, fields, and understand schema structure through MCP tools. NEVER assume schema - always discover first.

arguments.name: task
arguments.description: Discovery objective (e.g., 'find order tables', 'show customer schema', 'explore sales module'). Optional - if not provided, returns full discovery guide.

query-building.md.name: query-building
query-building.md.description: GraphQL query construction guidelines and best practices. Choose query types, build filters, apply sorting/pagination, optimize performance, and validate queries before execution.

arguments.name: task
arguments.description: Query requirement (e.g., 'get active users with email', 'top 10 products by revenue', 'filter orders by date range'). Optional - if not provided, returns full query building guide.

analysis.md.name: analysis
analysis.md.description: Iterative data analysis workflow with query chaining. Discover → Query → Analyze → Refine cycle. Use data-inline_graphql_result, discovery-data_object_field_values, and jq transforms for multi-iteration analysis.

arguments.name: task
arguments.description: Analysis objective (e.g., 'customer distribution by region', 'sales trends over time', 'identify outliers'). Optional - if not provided, returns full analysis guide.
